As a player who has been playing games created by Wargaming for roughly 8 years now, I can firmly stand my point as to who these games are for, and potentially the community as well. I started in world of tanks blitz, so I do have many more hours knowing the World of Tanks games in general. These games let you have so many options as to what you want, not just the tech tree, but the entire missions system and reward tanks. You can play for free, but the game will be time consuming, although most likely not boring. When you pay money, you get the bonus of premium account, maybe premium tanks, which will significantly increase your ability to play through the game quickly. What must be noted is that this game is an arcade strategy game, and it requires a lot of patience and time to learn, I have a long way to go. This is worth it to those who are both competitive or noncompetitive, so long as you seek enjoyment from the game in the right places, you will be granted your wish.
A little pay2fast but you can win with the f2p tanks. You need to grind but this is the fun of this game.

It was alright, if you like tanks then this is the perfect game for you, quick match system but most of the player base are dead lol. you can run this game with a semi potato card and it runs just well. For the buying tanks part, you have to grind for research points on a certain tanks to unlock another, like a tech tree system. Grind if you want to, but hoping in once in a while for a quick tank match feels satisfying.
I would highly recommend this game to others that are seeking, a PvP style, team co-op orientated playing experience.

If you're a sucker for punishment, then by all means play this hot garbage.

Played this game for years back in the mid-late 2010's.  Used to be a fun game.  Took a break for awhile. Came back and was excited to see it was on Steam.  However, you cannot access your old account through Steam.  This is ridiculous.  Feels like a scummy way to get older players to spend money to get back to where they were on their old account if they want to play via Steam for whatever reason.  If that's not the reason, then are the devs just lazy? Incompetent?  There is no good reason you shouldn't be able to access your old account via Steam.  I sank a lot of time into that account, even spent some money in-game. Until they change this, I will not be playing this game again.

[h1] Here is the method to get a better life quality [h1]

[i] Help >> Steam Support >> World of Tanks >> I want to permanently remove this game from my account [i]

Artillery can kill you easily from across the map. You don't know when your tank is spotted. You might not be able to see the tank shooting you. You might not be able to penetrate the armour of the tank shooting you. You aim slow so if you try to shoot back you either miss or die aiming. Just sit in a bush forever and maybe someone lets you shoot them. Very campy game. Premium ammo gives a much bigger advantage than I could have imagined. Tried it for 1 game and was doing well over 25x damage as before. Grind is very slow too, even with premium time. 10 hrs and still only have 2 tier 4s. Matchmaking is also very slow.

World of Warships is a much better game.

There is a learning curve. The game can be brutal when you're new and learning.

There are many toxic players, endless crybabies, noobs of every flavor.
For every twenty of them there is one good person who will help you out here and there.

Premium ammo, premium tanks, tanks you'll never be able to get, seal clubbers, and the ever present and forever annoying Arty.

If you can get past that and are willing to learn, the game is fun without using any money.
You just have to put in the work, learn by watching You Tube and Twitch, and keep at it.

Biggest two tips I can give you as a new player to other new players.......

Number one: Don't be first. Do not rush to the front. Play a support role. 
Learn the maps, help out, don't be the first one dead every game.

Number two: ALWAYS check the mini map, games change fast and if you're not aware of the big picture you get wrecked.
Always look at that mini map, every 10 seconds.
